issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192:
This adds 5 additional columns to the ResultSet of GetTables.  This is for compliance with the official JDBC API:

See:  http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/sql/DatabaseMetaData.html#getTables(java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String,%20java.lang.String[])

fields.summary: GetSchemas thrift call is slow on scale of 1000+ databases

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The GetTables thrift call takes a long time when the number of table is large.

With around 5000 tables, the call takes around 80 seconds compared to a "Show Tables" query on the same HiveServer2 instance which takes 3-7 seconds.
fields.summary: GetTables thrift call is very slow

comments.body: getTables() is the first call from most BI tools but it takes so much time with 100+ databases. I think it's worth to make a dedicated API in metastore for this.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12768576 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Fails seemed not related to this. Reduced time for GetTables from 80sec to 9 sec in my case.
[~navis], this jira is for getTables call very slow when there are more than 100 databases; not when there are more than 5000 tables in a database. Is that right?

Patch seems to help a lot!  I think it helps for when many tables case too, I dont know about the case of many database.

One small question, why can't table_types be a list instead of a large string in metastoreClient.getTableMetas() method?  The other MetastoreClient api's have arguments in list form, so it will be cleaner.  Is it for performance reasons?
[~navis] Can we also add some unit tests to cover the getTableMetas() call?

[~ychena] Sorry for my bad description. Retrieving all the Table instances from metastore is the the root cause of this, Not databases. For my case, I have 3000+ tables in 100+ databases.

[~szehon] I thought at first "table_types" was also a patten like other params but actually it was not. Would it be better to be String[] or List<String>?

[~aihuaxu] There are already some test cases (TestJdbcDriver2, for example) but I think I can add some more. Thanks.
Yes can you also change it to String[] or List<String> while you make the other changes?  Thanks for the great patch.
Addressed comments. Let's see test result.
Added short path for getSchemas(null). see HIVE-11702

Thanks @navis to add the coverage. Sorry, I didn't see the tests already there. 

Would it be better to create a class like TableMeta and return a list of TableMeta instead of list of strings? 

To Yongzhi's question: when we have many databases, the performance of the original getTables could be bad since we are making at least one trip for each database. Is that right?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12769216 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
Rebased to trunk & addressed comment

[~aihuaxu] Wanted method signature to be simplistic but so be it. (used TableMetaData by mistake. I'll change it to TableMeta in next patch)

bq. To Yongzhi's question: when we have many databases, the performance of the original getTables could be bad since we are making at least one trip for each database. Is that right?

It would be one of the root cause. But seeing HIVE-11702, it takes much time though getSchema(null) uses just one call to metastore. Pattern matching query seems much more expensive than expected(Even with simple * pattern)

Thanks [~navis] for the explanation. TableMetaData is also fine to me.

+1.
+1 from my side too, thanks for cleaning up the API
